intro: Lipskyella annua, commonly known as the annual lipskyella, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. The plant is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
